intro: Ginoria lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ginoria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
